forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 48. West wind around 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of drizzle before 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West wind 5 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn approaches in Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a cool whisper of moisture, teased by the possibility of drizzle. The sky, cloaked in a soft blanket of clouds, holds little promise of vibrant sunlight just yet, hinting at an overcast morning that might cling to the day. With temperatures resting in the chill of the early hours, a light jacket could serve as a comforting companion, though layers will prove wise as the day unfolds. 

As the sun rises and the city stirs, there is a modest chance of drizzle lingering until afternoon, but whispers of sunshine herald a gradual shift. The expected high will draw ever closer to a cool 55 degrees, a reminder of the fleeting warmth of the season. If venture beckons, a brisk walk through the streets or a visit to one of the city's quaint coffee shops may elevate spirits, wrapped in the essence of this unique winter morning. The fog, an ever-present character, seems subdued, perhaps retreating to the iconic hills that cradle the city, leaving room for a modest, yet inviting day.
